Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
CAN: Attempt to draw a plant, but the details may be unclear or indistinct (e.g., basic lines or shapes that don't resemble a plant strongly).
Include random elements like the sun, but not necessarily in a way that depicts its role in plant growth (e.g., the sun might be in the corner but not shown relevant to the plant).
CANNOT: Accurately depict the difference between a plant with water and a plant without water (student may draw two identical plants or miss clear differences in appearance).
Show a plant looking healthy and strong when it has enough water (student might not depict health indicators such as green leaves or an upright stem).
Illustrate a plant as weak or wilted when it lacks water (student might forget drooping or color changes, or not depict wilting).
Understand or show the concept of changes over time if a plant does not receive water (student might not show any progression or change, due to lack of understanding).
